hint.text: Assume that after leaving the rope the stone travels in the direction of the tangent at point P

solution.text:
let O denote the position of Rohan
OC=_{{13*j}}_ is given
As PC is the tangent to the circle in which the rope rotates
line OP joining the centre to point P is perpendicular to PC
Also the length of OP=radius=_{{5*j}}_cm
therefore a right-angle triangle(OPC) is formed
By Pythagoras theorem we can find PC
PC=\(\sqrt {OC^2-OP^2}\)
\(\Rightarrow PC =_{{12*j}}_\,cm\)

content.text:
Rohan ties a stone at an end of a _{{5*j}}_cm rope and rotates the rope by holding it at the other end forming a circle in the horizontal plane.
After few rotation when the stone reaches to the point P in the circle, it accidently loosen it's grip and leaves the rope,
if the stone hits at point C on the wall,_{{13*j}}_cm away from Rohan,
find the distance between point C and P
